events.name: XBOX, PS4 Controller key map in Google Chrome

events.comment:
In Firefox the key map may be different!

Xbox Controller :
0  =  a
1  =  b
2  =  x
3  =  y
4  =  lb
5  =  rb
6  =  lt
7  =  rt
8  =  back
9  =  start
10 =  click stick left
11 =  click stick right
12 =  top
13 =  bottom
14 =  left
15 =  right

Axis 0 = left stick up/down
Axis 1 = left stick left/right
Axis 2 = right stick up/down
Axis 3 = right stick left/right

PS4 Controller:
0  =  X
1  =  CIRCLE
2  =  SQUARE
3  =  TRIANGLE
4  =  L1
5  =  R1
6  =  L2
7  =  R2
8  =  SHARE
9  =  OPTIONS
10 =  CLICK LEFT STICK
11 =  CLICK RIGHT STICK
12 =  ARROW UP
13 =  ARROW DOWN
14 =  ARROW LEFT
15 =  ARROW RIGHT
16 = PS BUTTON
17 = CLICK TOUCH

Axis 0 = left stick up/down
Axis 1 = left stick left/right
Axis 2 = right stick up/down
Axis 3 = right stick left/right
You can hide the Debug layer in case you don't want to display this information
Update text objects to display what buttons are used

[HERE] You can bind your events for each axes !
We have bind the axis to work witht the Platformer behavior
get maximum speed of the player character
we are controlling the character with the left stick, if we don't move the left stick, reset the speed to be the maximum speed
If the left stick is pushed right, simulate right press key and multiply speed by the value of axis so we can control the speed of the character smoothly
If the left stick is pushed left, simulate left press key and multiply speed by the value of axis so we can control the speed of the character smoothly

[HERE] you can bind yours event for each button ! The buttons are mapped for Google Chrome, in Firefox the buttons may different
TXT_btn_pressed is updated only for debugging purposes so you can easily map your controller, you can disable it if you don't need it, this text object also placed on a spearated layer called Debug, you can also hide the layer if you don't want to display this info but I recommend not to remove it, so you can map any gamepad, any time you want
